preqs: Students must have completed the following five units:ACF1100, ACF2100, ACF2200, ACF2400, and ACF3200.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {09-4, 10, 41, 50}
For COURSE_CODE IN {B20031} Do Must have passed 5 (I/W) units in {ACF1100, ACF2100, ACF2200, ACF2400, ACF3200} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true

description: This capstone unit integrates prior learning gained throughout the Bachelor of Accounting course and prepares students for transition to a professional career and for undertaking postgraduate studies. Students will be required to analyse, synthesise, critically evaluate, and apply knowledge and skills acquired over the course of their studies to real-world scenarios. Students will also be required to reflect on the role of accounting in organisations and society more generally, and will develop professional judgement, as well as the key skills that are expected of accountants.
